Title: developer can create a project
Description:
by navigating to /projects/new

project needs
 - name
 - 4 character display code

on successful creation you can see the project appear on /projects

Title: developer can see the projects list
Description:
by navigating to /projects

list displays

```
| Code | Name                 |
| LAAC | LA Architecture Club |
```

Title: developer can add a project from the list page
Description: by navigating to /projects and clicking on **Add Project +** the developer is taken to the /projects/new page

Title: team can see a project tile
Description:
by navigating to /tiles the team can see a tile for each project in the system

tile displays
 - 4 character display code

main background is black. tile background is grey. each tile should be a bootstrap .col-md-4 width

Title: developer can add a Travis CI project
Description:
while editing the project, the developer can specify 
 - github account name
 - github repository name

for OSS projects from which build information will be published.

e.g **LA-Architecture-Club** / **clean-architecture-1**

Title: team can see the status of the most recent build on refresh
Description:
status should reflect the most recent Travis build status by making the tile background
 - **failure** red
 - **successful** green

Travis API
 - [making requests](http://docs.travis-ci.com/api/#making-requests)
 - [Travis Builds](http://docs.travis-ci.com/api/#builds)

Title: team can see the status of the most recent build w/o refresh
Description: tile should automatically update status within a reasonable delta of Travis API update
Comment: For the purpose of exploring Clean architecture, consider polling the Travis API rather than using a webhook. Also consider implementing browser updates with [Server Sent Events](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Server-sent_events/Using_server-sent_events) in [Spring 4.2](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Server-sent_events/Using_server-sent_events) (Michael McCormick - Aug 4, 2015)

Title: team can see status of a Jenkins project
